alert.note: Alert for Allen; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe and southeastern Allen Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 340 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Scottsville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Monroe and southeastern Allen Counties, including the following locations... Rodemer, Oak Forest, Maynard, Fountain Run, Akersville, Petroleum, Forest Springs, Holland and Amos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
